intro: Xylobium sublobatum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed xylobium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its herbaceous stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Xylobium sublobatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
